text: Hello I was wondering if I can discuss the effects of the pandemic have on my mental health.
speaker: usr

text: Hello
speaker: sys

text: How has the pandemic affected your mental health?
speaker: sys

text: Well, right now my city is undergoing a second wave and it was doing very well so far, but in the past two weeks, have been a slow and steady surge of daily cases. Just feeling stress and fear from the second wave.
speaker: usr

text: I understand how hard living through this pandemic is. It is such crazy time! I also have felt fear and stress from the second wave of the pandemic.
speaker: sys

text: It is natural to feel stressed when there is a global pandemic.
speaker: sys

text: I am sure with the correct coping strategies you can handle this pandemic!
speaker: sys

text: yeah it's crazy. I am starting to feel paranoid and stressed everytime I go out for groceries. I work once or twice a week outside of the home and I generally get groceries once every two weeks, but my guard is up again, ever since the first wave was gone by the end of summer.
speaker: usr

text: I am also sorry to hear that you have stress from this. I sympathize fully.
speaker: usr

text: I have been doing grocery pick-up because of the pandemic, so I sympathize with you.
speaker: sys

text: Thank you for the positive message and believing in me.
speaker: usr

text: Wearing a mask and using hand sanitizer can keep you safe and healthy while grocery shopping.
speaker: sys

text: grocery pick-up, that's not a bad coping mechanism. I don't know, I don't want to spend the extra money for the special handling though, plus I just feel paranoid having someone touch my groceries. But that's just me.
speaker: usr

text: sanitizer I should probably get, just a disposable one to keep on me at all times.
speaker: usr

text: Practicing mindfulness and going on a short walk in nature can help with your stress.
speaker: sys

text: yes that would help I suppose, just that I stopped going out, to the gym, movies, anything frivolous ever since the pandemic started.
speaker: usr

text: At some grocery stores, they have made pick-up free due to the pandemic. You should look into that if you are interested in it.
speaker: sys

text: My life was put on a pause and I still can't believe it's november already.
speaker: usr

text: I also have stopped going out since the pandemic started.
speaker: sys

text: ok, I will look into the grocery method.
speaker: usr

text: Just from chatting with you, you seem to be very open to suggestions and are devoted to making it through these crazy times.
speaker: sys

text: Has your work life been affected by the pandemic?
speaker: sys

text: so literally, I only go out for a purpose, meaning special errands like groceries and personal administrative tasks, banking, work, and only that.
speaker: usr

text: work life, let me think
speaker: usr

text: I only started a new work in September, and it's not much (about two days a week), so I can't comment too much about that. It is stressful seeing more people than usual outside of my home and in such close quarters
speaker: usr

text: Yes, I also only go out for groceries and work. I only work with a few people, so that helps.
speaker: sys

text: so I get nervous in general when I am at work but I do my work just the same. May not be able to work as well because I have to breathe through a mask, and some other small difficulties.
speaker: usr

text: That is good that you can continue to do your work the same.
speaker: sys

text: Thank you for all the positive messages so far and in understanding and sympathizing with me.
speaker: usr

text: Is there anything else I should know about how the pandemic is affecting you?
speaker: sys

text: pretty much. If anything, it's my academic life at home that has changed not so well.
speaker: usr

text: Are you a student?
speaker: sys

text: yes, I take online courses and I tend to procrastinate a lot more and get distracted as I find myself more and more at home. Just getting carried away and now have impending deadlines.
speaker: usr

text: I can get through it but it has had a toll on my productivity.
speaker: usr

text: I was just taking my sweet time with it and that wasn't good
speaker: usr

text: I am also a student and am not motivated to do school work at home, so I completely understand. I am sure you are successful at school!
speaker: sys

text: Having a planner may keep you organized and on-task.
speaker: sys

text: Dedicating a certain time frame and area for school work might help, as well.
speaker: sys

text: Dedicating a certain time frame and area for school work might help, as well.
speaker: sys

text: Because prior to the pandemic, I was pretty regimented with set schedules and can clear my mind with work-outs and going to the gym and movies, but now it's not that simple.
speaker: usr

text: Is there anything else I can help you with?
speaker: sys

text: Thank you and I hope your schooling goes well also.
speaker: usr

text: Thank you, you too!
speaker: sys

text: yeah I like your idea of dedicating the time. I find that I am slacking off and being disorganized in areas like time management. So yes I have to improve on that.
speaker: usr

text: I suppose you have been doing your schooling relatively better in your situation?
speaker: usr

text: I hope you do anyhow
speaker: usr

text: Great ideas! Is there anything else I can help you with?
speaker: sys

text: would you have any other advice on how to overcome things like time management with academics? like how to avoid procrastination?
speaker: usr

text: Because this was so much better in the past that I just had set schedules and can clear my mind by going out, etc.
speaker: usr

text: and feeling refreshed and feeling the urgency to study again.
speaker: usr

text: But that's gone for me now.
speaker: usr

text: I would reccomend setting deadlines in your planner of when tasks need to be completed and also setting timers for 20 minutes at a time where you have to focus for that long before you can do any other task.
speaker: sys

text: Great, I think that's a good area for me to go into.
speaker: usr

text: Timers and set agendas
speaker: usr

text: Yes!
speaker: sys

text: like a timetable when they used to hand out when I used to be in high school, let's say
speaker: usr

text: and this hour I do this, etc.
speaker: usr

text: and as you say, yoga or work out in between
speaker: usr

text: all great ideas I think
speaker: usr

text: Yes, excellent!
speaker: sys

text: thank you for that.
speaker: usr

text: ok then. I think I am set now to get back to my studies then with a refreshed mind.
speaker: usr

text: You are so welcome. Have a great day!
speaker: sys

text: Thank you for all your help. You as well and I hope your studies and work go well.
speaker: usr

text: have a great day also
speaker: usr

text: Thank you! Talk to you later.
